page.title: 09Local Customs
page.content: Each year, as in many Royal Burghs in South Scotland, Sanquhar elects three principals - the Cornet, his Lass, and their "protector" the Ensign - to lead the Riding of the Marches. During the week-long festivities the March Riding Standard is flown over the town and there is a variety of activities for all ages. On the Saturday, the Burgh Piper rouses the townsfolk at 6am; at 8am the Cornet and his party are sworn in before setting off at the head of a cavalcade of riders to inspect the town's boundaries. On his return, the Cornet reports on the condition of the Marches, the Sanquhar Queen is crowned and then follows a day of outdoor entertainment (parades, sports, massed bands,funfair) ending with a fireworks display at 10pm. Many of the riders are Principals from other towns with similar festivities.
